author: CMD
text:
Sneaker quality inspection is a scam!  Don't buy or you will be stuck. 

I ordered a pair of sneakers from StockX for my wife.  StockX verified them and shipped them to me. My wife tried them on for 2 minutes inside.  They weren't comfortable so I listed them on StockX.    Someone purchased them from me so I shipped them back to StockX.  StockX said the condition was not up to their standards.  REDICULOUS since they are in exact condition that they approved when I bought them.  Now I am stuck with $300 shoes.  DON'T BE A FOOL.  They sent me pictures of their current review but couldn't produce the pictures of the original review when I bought them.
-----------------
Adding additional comments after StockX's response.   You can see StockX's response is vague and generalized, does not address specifics of my issue, and then put's the onus on me to contact them again after I've contact them about six directly.  They have no intent to resolve this.  They hope you think the issue ultimately gets resolved but it hasn't and I have no faith in StockX to do the right thing.

----UPDATE---
It's now almost two months later and StockX is holding my shoes hostage.  They have neither paid me nor returned the shoes to me.  I highly recommend buying and selling sneakers elsewhere.
title: Sneaker inspection is high risk gamble

author: Lindsey Gannaway
text:

Complete scam.

text:

author: Intangible
text:
I had successfully completed 16 sales on StockX before my most recent (and final) transaction with them. I shipped them a pair of Jordan 4 OREO's ($550USD), and UPS lost the package somewhere along the line. UPS then sent StockX an approved lost package claim email TWICE.

I then asked StockX to respond to the claim, and to forward me the compensation amount. After going back and forth with email 'support' in 15+ emails, StockX is now denying working with UPS, or their lost package claim process. What??

I am now out a pair of expensive Jordans, as they are pretending there's nothing they can do. Never thought I'd post on one of these sites, but this horribly lazy and nonsensical business practice brought it out of me.
title: Started out fine...never again.

author: Sergio
text: Put in a bid for a pack of cards for $115 plus fees. A seller accepted the bid and I was immediately charged $143.33. Which was fine. According to their website and emails I received after my order went through the sellers have 2 business days to ship your item to StockX. My order went through on a Thursday. 2 business days meant that the seller had until the end of the day on Monday to ship my order out. I sent them a message on Tuesday asking why the seller never shipped my order. I was told they were giving the seller until midnight on Tuesday. (An extra day) The seller still did not ship my order and now I have to wait 3-7 business days for them to refund me my money. They are very strict about buyers not being allowed to cancel an order. However it appears sellers can take an order on have the money taken from your account and then just decide they don’t want to sell it anymore?!?
title: Buyers are not the priority

author: David Williamson
text:
Stockx is a horrible company! They will not work with you if an item is lost and when it is their responsibility to file a claim with FedEx. They don’t provide customer service except to automated chat services. I would not sell or buy items from them ever again!

Response to the Auto Response below:
Stockx is really great at putting up responses on this platform…..it is interesting that you cannot speak to a customer service agent (nor was a number provided to resolve the issue even in the response below - just a link to a chat service where they don’t respond.) However, they found a way to respond here in less then an hour. That folks is their priority….The goal seems to be to take the money and not work to help or resolve issues to the customer (which are impossible to avoid) and supply any semblance of CS. This response below is nothing more then a smoke screen. The package did not come directly from the seller it goes through Stockx. So if the package is lost the only person who can file a claim to resolve the issue is Stockx. If you can’t reach Stockx they can’t file a claim. In my case Stockx knows I cannot file a claim from my end (hence the smoke screen.) However, with all the Mombo jumbo there is never an offer to file a claim, resend the merchandise or return the money back with the feedback provided below. That is why I will never, ever do busy with the company again….. Horrible is the term I think I used……I STAND BY THAT STATEMENT!
title: Stockx is a horrible company
